subject: Politics
title: Religious Conservatism
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Religious Conservatism.

hook.text: In America, the religious right shaped policy on abortion, marriage, and education for decades.

buildup.text: Religious conservatism grounds politics in faith. Moral law comes from God, not human legislation.

discovery.text: The Moral Majority, founded in 1979, mobilized evangelical Christians as a powerful voting bloc.

twist.text: Religious conservatism exists in every faith. Islamic, Hindu, and Jewish conservatives share similar goals.

climax.text: Secular critics say religion in politics threatens freedom. Believers say morality needs a foundation.

punchline.text: Religious conservatives want God in government. Critics want a wall.

quiz.question: What was the Moral Majority?
options: A movement that mobilized evangelical Christians as a political force
